WERKHEISER OUT - RAISES OPPONENT AND LEADS CHALLENGERS STATEWIDE	U-PER O O O U-PER O O U-PER O
Greg Werkheiser , candidate for the House of Delegates from the 42nd District in southern Fairfax County , has raised significantly more money to date than his incumbent opponent , David Albo , and leads all challengers statewide in fundraising , according to reports filed with the State Board of Elections on January 18 , 2005 .	B-PER L-PER O B-PER I-PER I-PER|B-ORG I-PER|I-ORG I-PER|I-ORG I-PER|L-ORG I-PER I-PER|B-GPE I-PER|I-GPE I-PER|I-GPE I-PER|I-GPE I-PER|I-GPE|B-LOC I-PER|I-GPE|I-LOC L-PER|L-GPE|L-LOC O O O O O O O O O B-PER|U-PER I-PER L-PER O B-PER L-PER O O O B-PER I-PER L-PER O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O O O O O O
Werkheiser out - raised his opponent by almost 2 to 1 : Werkheiser $ 81 , 615 ; Albo $ 55 , 119 .	U-PER O O O B-PER|U-PER L-PER O O O O O O U-PER O O O O O U-PER O O O O O
Werkheiser now has twice as much unencumbered cash on hand as his opponent : Werkheiser $ 50 , 017 ; Albo $ 23 , 767	U-PER O O O O O O O O O O B-PER|U-PER L-PER O U-PER O O O O O U-PER O O O O
Werkheiser ' s contributions come from 200 individuals ; Albo had 8 individual contributors .	U-PER O O O O O B-PER L-PER O U-PER O B-PER I-PER L-PER O
Werkheiser leads all challengers statewide in total contributions raised and funds on - hand .	U-PER O B-PER I-PER L-PER O O O O O O O O O O
The 42nd House of Delegates District forms the southern tip of Fairfax County .	B-GPE I-GPE I-GPE I-GPE I-GPE L-GPE O B-LOC I-LOC I-LOC I-LOC I-LOC|B-GPE L-LOC|L-GPE O
Nearly fifty - two percent of the district voted for John Kerry in 2004 , and Governor Mark Warner won the district with similar margins in 2001 .	B-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER|B-GPE L-PER|L-GPE O O B-PER L-PER O O O O B-PER|U-PER I-PER L-PER O B-GPE L-GPE O O O O O O
" I am humbled by the support of so many citizens in the 42nd District who are voting with their pocketbooks for a change in leadership .	O U-PER O O O O O O B-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER|B-GPE I-PER|I-GPE I-PER|L-GPE I-PER|U-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER|U-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER L-PER O
While we are very pleased with this outpouring of support , I am going to keep doing what I have been doing : listening to my neighbors and working to make our communities in Fairfax County a better place to live , work and raise a family , " stated Werkheiser .	O U-ORG O O O O O O O O O U-PER O O O O O O U-PER O O O O O O B-PER|U-PER L-PER O O O O B-GPE|U-GPE I-GPE I-GPE I-GPE|B-GPE L-GPE|L-GPE B-GPE I-GPE I-GPE I-GPE I-GPE I-GPE I-GPE I-GPE I-GPE I-GPE|B-PER L-GPE|L-PER O O O U-PER O

Economic Development Accountability ?	O O O O
The Augusta Free Press ( motto : " Our only agenda is the truth " ) has a Chris Graham story on a Del .	B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O O O O U-ORG O O O O O O O O O B-PER L-PER O O O U-PER O
Chap Peterson , D - Fairfax , bill that would require payback by companies lured to Virginia by incentives if they do not stay for five years .	O O O U-ORG O U-GPE O O O O O O O O O O U-GPE O O O O O O O O O O O

Peterson , of course , is a candidate for the Lt .	U-PER O O O O O O O O O O O
Governor nomination .	O O O
Graham ' s article has the interesting hook of quoting one of Peterson ' s rivals , former Congresswoman and State Sen . Leslie Byrne , as approving of the measure because it ' s " something that I ' ve been talking about for some time now . "	U-PER O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER I-PER|B-PER|U-PER I-PER|I-PER I-PER|I-PER L-PER|L-PER O B-PER|B-PER|B-PER I-PER|I-PER|I-PER I-PER|I-PER|I-PER I-PER|I-PER|I-PER|U-GPE I-PER|L-PER|L-PER I-PER I-PER L-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O U-PER O O O O O O O O O O O
The Virginia Economic Developers Association has not taken a stance on the bill , but the organization ' s leadership is expected to meet tomorrow to discuss it .	B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O O O O O O O O O O B-PER|B-ORG I-PER|L-ORG I-PER I-PER L-PER O O O O O O O O O

I would expect them to oppose it .	U-PER O O U-PER O O O O

Hey , what ' s this blog , chopped liver ?	O O O O O O O O O O O
If I recall correctly , the last time that Virginia seriously addressed the " incentives " issue was during the Allen administration .	O U-PER O O O O O O O U-GPE O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG|U-PER L-ORG O
The idea then was to peg incentives to performance : If the touted jobs and investment don ' t materialize , you lose the tax breaks and incentives .	O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O U-ORG O O O O O O O
By demanding accountability , Peterson ' s bill is in the spirit of Virginia ' s existing policy , thought perhaps somewhat tougher .	O O O O U-PER O O O O O O O O U-GPE O O O O O O O O O O
Will Verhrs wrote : " Hey , what ' s this blog , chopped liver ? "	B-PER L-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
I ' m not a certifiable Blogophile yet .	U-PER O O O B-PER I-PER L-PER O O

The same might be said of Chap ' s condiment - packaged business bill .	O O O O O O U-PER O O O O O O O O
Delegate Chap Petersen bill is nothing more than salt and pepper electioneering in the 2005 statewide campaign - - and is probably tied into the Democratic outsourcing clamor and growing threat of more manufacturing plants closing , which John Kerry politically contrived and sensationalized for the 04 presidential run .	B-PER|U-PER I-PER L-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O U-GPE O O O O O O O O O U-ORG O O O O O O O B-ORG L-ORG O O O B-PER L-PER O O O O O O O O O O
Residents throughout the commonwealth of Virginia and the rest of the nation are economically vulnerable due to free trade agreements and the global economy .	B-PER I-PER I-PER|B-GPE I-PER|I-GPE I-PER|I-GPE I-PER|L-GPE|U-GPE I-PER I-PER|B-GPE I-PER|I-GPE I-PER|I-GPE I-PER|I-GPE|B-GPE L-PER|L-GPE|L-GPE O O O O O O O O O O U-LOC O O
But both parties are responsible and have voted in favor of those agreements .	O B-ORG L-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O
Governor candidate ' s Chap Peterson and Leslie Byrne are both good politicians , but need to start thinking outside the box with legislation that will attract and benefit economic growth for the business world and create sustainable workplaces for Virginians .	O O O O O O O B-PER L-PER O U-PER B-PER L-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O U-GPE O
Will , I agree with your analysis , the VA business community along with a majority of GA members will probably deep - six this 5 - year mandatory requirement for compensation due to relocation .	U-PER O U-PER O O U-PER O O O U-GPE O O O O B-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER|B-PER|U-ORG L-PER|L-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
If not bordering on the political ridorkulous ( ridiculously dorky ) , it ' s just plain ludicrous to believe business owners would agree to a capital investment with strings attached to the businesses health and longevity .	O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER L-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Reward - to - punishment - to - reward maybe good dog training techniques , but it ' s not very business friendly .	O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The Commonwealth needs legislation that requires a mandatory Employee Stock Ownership Plan ( ESOP ) within the contractual economic development agreements .	B-GPE L-GPE O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The ESOP is itself a corporate finance vehicle that provides monetary incentives with lending institutes , state and federal tax benefits , new capital investment , and most of all , the stock ownership plan increases VA employee capital wealth .	O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG L-ORG O U-GPE O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER|U-GPE L-PER O O O
More capital wealth will drive our consumer - base economy through the flipping roof .	O O O O O U-GPE U-PER O O O O O O O O
But most importantly , how many Virginia businesses will choose to relocate - - or outsource when employee are the corporate stockowners ?	O O O O O O U-GPE O O O O O O O O O O U-PER O B-PER I-PER L-PER O
And lets say the business has no other choice but to remove to the third world . . .	O U-PER O O O O O O O O O O O B-GPE I-GPE L-GPE O O O
When Virginia ' s employees are fully vested in company stock , they will also reap from the profits of lower wages in the global marketplace just like the corporate big boys .	O B-PER|U-GPE I-PER I-PER L-PER O O O O O O O U-PER O O O O O O O O O O O U-LOC O O O O O O O O

Who other than a left - wing liberal would agree to represent a two - time murderer ( Lem Tugle ) for free , to try and keep him from getting the death penalty . Anti - Gerrymandering : Is Virginia Ready ?	O O O O O O O O
Many of the good - governiks who write for Bacon ' s Rebellion have pointed out the deleterious effects of gerrymandering on Virginia .	B-PER I-PER I-PER|B-PER I-PER|I-PER I-PER|I-PER I-PER|I-PER I-PER|I-PER|U-PER I-PER|I-PER I-PER|I-PER I-PER|I-PER|B-ORG I-PER|I-PER|I-ORG I-PER|I-PER|I-ORG L-PER|L-PER|L-ORG O O O O O O O O O U-GPE O
Some would say the problems are on display in Capitol Square right now .	U-PER O O O O O O O O B-LOC L-LOC O O O
There ' s an anti - gerrymandering movement gaining a small head of steam in California .	O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O U-GPE O
The Golden State often leads the way for the nation on " reform , " for good or ill . Mickey Kaus of Slate reminds us that the California initiative bears watching and we should follow the motives of those who support or oppose the current redistricting process .	B-GPE I-GPE L-GPE O O O O O B-GPE L-GPE O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER I-PER L-PER|U-ORG O U-PER O O U-GPE O O O O U-PER O O O O O B-PER I-PER|U-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER L-PER O
Mickey cites two Stuart Taylor articles on the subject that should be required reading for any who would debate the issue , here and here .	U-PER O O B-PER L-PER O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER|U-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER L-PER O O O O O
Hand in hand with any consideration of the redistricting process , we shoul give some thought to the structural relationship between the state House and Senate .	O O O O O O O O O O O U-PER O O O O O O O O O B-ORG|B-ORG I-ORG|I-ORG|U-GPE I-ORG|I-ORG I-ORG|I-ORG L-ORG|L-ORG O
Currently , each House member represents approximately 75 , 000 Virginians , while each Senator represents appoximately 187 , 500 .	O O B-PER I-PER|U-ORG L-PER O B-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER L-PER O O B-PER L-PER O B-PER I-PER I-PER L-PER O
Often as not , there is no rational commonality between the two .	O O O O O O O O O O B-PER L-PER O
Some senators represent people pools that are in turn fractured into five or six House districts .	B-PER L-PER O B-PER|U-PER I-PER I-PER|U-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER|B-LOC I-PER|I-LOC I-PER|I-LOC I-PER|I-LOC|U-ORG L-PER|L-LOC O
I believe this accounts , in large part , for the dysfunction that characterizes our state government now .	U-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-GPE|U-GPE I-GPE|U-GPE L-GPE O O
Former Governor Gerald Baliles , in this same vein , has advocated a realignment of the two houses in a way that serves commonalities .	B-PER|B-PER I-PER|L-PER I-PER L-PER O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER L-PER O O O O O O O
He has suggested that we either increase membership in the Senate to 50 , or decrease House membership to 80 , producing a scenario wherein 1 Senator would represent a block of people who are represented by exactly 2 Delegates .	U-PER O O O U-GPE O O B-PER I-PER I-PER|B-ORG L-PER|L-ORG O U-PER O O O B-PER|U-ORG L-PER O U-PER O O O O O B-PER L-PER O O B-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER|U-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER|B-PER I-PER|I-PER L-PER|L-PER O
He thinks - - and I think he is right - - that this arrangement would foster a closer working relationship between the Senate and the House .	U-PER O O O O U-PER O U-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG L-ORG O B-ORG L-ORG O
You certainly wouldn ' t have these dysfunctional groupings we now have , where 1 Senator often represents a population divided among half a dozen Delegates of two parties - - three , if you count independents .	U-PER O O O O O B-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER|U-GPE I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER|U-PER I-PER|B-PER I-PER|L-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER|B-PER I-PER|I-PER I-PER|I-PER I-PER|I-PER I-PER|I-PER|B-PER I-PER|I-PER|I-PER I-PER|I-PER|I-PER I-PER|I-PER|I-PER I-PER|I-PER|I-PER I-PER|I-PER|I-PER|B-ORG I-PER|I-PER|I-PER|L-ORG I-PER|I-PER|I-PER I-PER|I-PER|I-PER I-PER|I-PER|I-PER|U-ORG I-PER|I-PER|I-PER I-PER|I-PER|I-PER I-PER|I-PER|I-PER|U-PER I-PER|I-PER|I-PER L-PER|L-PER|L-PER|U-PER O

A Pitiful , Helpless Giant	O O O O O
Anyone who has spent any time in NVA over the last 40 years is familiar with the Giant grocery store chain .	B-PER I-PER|U-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER|U-LOC I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER L-PER O O O B-ORG I-ORG|B-ORG|U-ORG I-ORG|I-ORG I-ORG|L-ORG L-ORG O
When the chain passed from its private owners a few years ago , problems began .	O B-ORG L-ORG O O B-PER|U-ORG I-PER L-PER O O O O O O O O
These problems multiplied when the New England chain Stop n ' Shop acquired Giant .	O O O O B-ORG|B-ORG I-ORG|I-ORG|B-LOC I-ORG|I-ORG|L-LOC I-ORG|L-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O U-ORG O

Virginia ' s Anti - Immigrant Voice	O O O O O O O
An old friend , Joseph Britt of Kennesaw , GA , recently emailed to ask about anti - immigration as an issue for Virginia Democrats .	B-PER I-PER L-PER O B-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER|B-GPE I-PER|I-GPE L-PER|L-GPE|U-GPE O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER|U-GPE L-PER O
Joe had just read a George W . Grayson article in the William & Mary Alumni Magazine , " Myths About Illegal Immigration . "	U-PER O O O O B-PER I-PER I-PER L-PER O O B-ORG I-ORG|B-PER|B-ORG I-ORG|I-PER|I-ORG I-ORG|I-PER|L-ORG I-ORG|L-PER L-ORG O O O O O O O O
Grayson does not cite any Virginia examples , but among the " myths " he attempts to explode are that illegal immigrants perform jobs Americans don ' t want and that they contribute more in taxes and social security than they take from government programs .	U-PER O O O O U-GPE O O O O O O O O U-PER O O O O O B-PER L-PER O O U-GPE O O O O O O U-PER O O O O O O O O U-PER O O U-ORG O O
I personally know a good number of immigrants , both legal and illegal .	U-PER O O B-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER L-PER O O O O O O
One fellow , a Brazilian , has done everything by the book .	B-PER L-PER O B-PER L-PER O O O O O O O O
He gets rewarded by having to pay an immigration attorney thousands of dollars while getting yanked around by the Immigration Service . . . not to mention , he ' s paying the government thousands in taxes .	U-PER O O O O O O B-PER I-PER L-PER O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O O O O O O O U-PER O O O B-GPE L-GPE O O O O
He gets very frustrated because many of his contemporaries work for cash under the table .	U-PER O O O O B-PER|B-PER I-PER|I-PER I-PER|I-PER|U-PER L-PER|L-PER O O O O O O O
They aren ' t paying lawyers , and they pay nothing into the system .	U-PER O O O O U-PER O O U-PER O O O O O O
Of course , the Americans who employ illegal immigrants are happy to pay in cash because it means cheaper labor for them .	O O O B-PER I-PER I-PER|U-PER I-PER I-PER|B-PER L-PER|L-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O U-PER O
Who benefits ?	U-PER O O
The illegal immigrants themselves , of course .	B-PER I-PER L-PER U-PER O O O O
The employers who hire them instead of raising wages to attract native - born Americans and legal immigrants .	B-PER I-PER I-PER|U-PER I-PER I-PER|U-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER|B-PER I-PER|I-PER I-PER|I-PER I-PER|L-PER I-PER I-PER|B-PER L-PER|L-PER O
And families who hire cheap domestic labor , whether to clean the house , wash the laundry or maintain the lawn .	O B-PER I-PER|U-PER I-PER I-PER|B-PER I-PER|I-PER I-PER|L-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER|B-FAC I-PER|L-FAC I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER L-PER O
Who loses ?	U-PER O O
Poor , native - born Americans who otherwise would be paid higher wages for their manual labor .	B-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER|U-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER|U-PER I-PER L-PER O
Legal immigrants like my Brazilian friend , who sometimes feels like a sap for playing by the rules .	B-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER|B-PER|U-PER I-PER|I-PER|U-GPE I-PER|I-PER I-PER|I-PER I-PER|I-PER|U-PER I-PER|I-PER I-PER|I-PER I-PER|I-PER I-PER|I-PER|B-PER I-PER|I-PER|L-PER I-PER|I-PER I-PER|I-PER I-PER|I-PER I-PER|I-PER L-PER|L-PER O
And the rest of us who won ' t hire anyone to work for us unless they ' re paying their taxes , even if it means we pay more .	O B-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER|U-PER I-PER|U-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER|U-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER|U-PER I-PER I-PER|U-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER|U-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER|U-PER I-PER L-PER O
Yeah , I ' ve got a problem with turning around and giving illegal immigrants all the rights and privileges of the native born and the legal immigrants who ' ve played by the rules .	O O U-PER O O O O O O O O O O B-PER L-PER O O O O O O B-PER I-PER L-PER O B-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER|U-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER L-PER O
Yes , I do .	O O U-PER O O
Where is Investigative Journalism ?	O O O O O
Governor Mark Warner has turned state government upside - down in an effort to do more business with small , women , and minority owned ( SWAM ) firms and the thanks he gets are headlines like this one in the Daily Press : Warner ' s plan to raise contracting diversity falls short .	B-PER|U-PER I-PER L-PER O O B-GPE|U-GPE L-GPE O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG|U-PER I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG|U-PER I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O O O U-PER O O O O O O O O O O O U-PER O O O O O O O O O O
The article is full of innuendo that procurement officals are ignoring the Governor ' s wishes and just waiting for him to leave office , that " special deals " are cut with non - SWAM vendors , and that somehow the electronic procurement system is " stacked " against SWAM firms .	O O O O O O O B-PER L-PER O O B-PER L-PER O O O O O O O U-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG|U-ORG L-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG|U-ORG L-ORG O
If true , these are serious charges , worthy of high - level investigation .	O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
What ' s missing from the article , though , is any attempt at investigative journalism to give even one factual example supporting the innuendo .	O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
What ' s also missing is a fair - minded review of whether the sagging numbers reported for SWAM procurement are valid .	O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O U-ORG O O O O
Someday a journalist is going to take the time to watch a sample number of SWAM firms submit bids on openly posted contracts , then use procurement tools that are in place to determine if any SWAM firms were unfairly denied contracts they deserved .	O B-PER L-PER O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG|U-ORG L-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG|U-ORG L-ORG O O O O U-ORG O O
Until then , this carping appears to be sour grapes .	O O O O O O O O O O O
Governor Warner has done plenty to open up the system to SWAM firms and give them a presumptive advantage , even inviting a backlash by non - SWAM firms .	B-PER|U-PER L-PER O O O O O O O O O B-ORG|U-ORG L-ORG O O U-ORG O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG|U-ORG L-ORG O
Maybe SWAM firms aren ' t doing all they can to return the Governor ' s faith in them .	O B-ORG|U-ORG L-ORG O O O O O U-ORG O O O B-PER L-PER O O O O U-ORG O
The dominant narrative among the Mainstream Media , even at a local level , is that the institutions of U . S . society are , to varying degrees , racist .	O O O O B-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG|B-GPE|B-GPE I-ORG|I-GPE|I-GPE I-ORG|I-GPE|L-GPE I-ORG|I-GPE L-ORG|L-GPE O O O O O O O O
Any shortcomings in minority achievement are to be explained as the result of discrimination of some sort .	O O O U-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
End of story .	O O O O
What ' s to investigate ?	O O O O O O
What need to examine " the other side of the story ? "	O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Here are some of the fine achievements of the terrorist Marwan Barghouti Marwan Barghouti ( born June 6 , 1958 ) is a Palestinian leader from the West Bank and a leader of the Fatah movement that forms the backbone of the Palestinian Authority and the Palestine Liberation Organization ( PLO ) .	O O O O O O O O B-PER|B-PER I-PER|L-PER I-PER L-PER B-PER L-PER O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER|U-GPE I-PER I-PER I-PER|B-LOC I-PER|I-LOC L-PER|L-LOC O B-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER|B-ORG I-PER|I-ORG I-PER|I-ORG I-PER|I-ORG I-PER|I-ORG I-PER|I-ORG I-PER|I-ORG I-PER|I-ORG I-PER|I-ORG|B-GPE I-PER|I-ORG|I-GPE I-PER|I-ORG|L-GPE I-PER|I-ORG I-PER|I-ORG|B-ORG I-PER|I-ORG|I-ORG I-PER|I-ORG|I-ORG I-PER|I-ORG|I-ORG I-PER|I-ORG|I-ORG L-PER|L-ORG|L-ORG|U-ORG O O
On June 6 , 2004 , he was sentenced to five life sentences for five murders of Israeli civilians and 40 years imprisonment for attempted murders in terrorist attacks against Israeli civilians .	O O O O O O U-PER O O O O O O O O O O B-PER|U-GPE L-PER O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER|U-GPE L-PER O
Barghouti was one of the major leaders of the First Intifada in 1987 , leading Palestinians in a mass uprising against Israeli occupation of the West Bank .	U-PER O B-PER I-PER I-PER|B-PER I-PER|I-PER I-PER|I-PER I-PER|I-PER I-PER|I-PER I-PER|I-PER I-PER|I-PER I-PER|I-PER L-PER|L-PER O O U-GPE O O O O O U-GPE O O B-LOC I-LOC L-LOC O
During the uprising , he was arrested by Israel and deported to Jordan , where he stayed for seven years until he was permitted to return under the terms of the Oslo Accords in 1994 .	O O O O U-PER O O O U-GPE O O O U-GPE O U-GPE U-PER O O O O O U-PER O O O O O O O O O U-GPE O O O O
In 1996 , he was elected to the Palestinian Legislative Council , in which he advocated peace with Israel , sometimes coming in conflict with Yasser Arafat .	O O O U-PER O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O O U-ORG U-PER O O O U-GPE O O O O O O B-PER L-PER O
The formal position occupied by Barghouti was the General Secretary of Fatah in the West Bank .	O O O O O U-PER O B-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER|U-ORG I-PER I-PER|B-LOC I-PER|I-LOC L-PER|L-LOC O
By the summer of 2000 , Barghouti and Arafat had grown increasingly at odds with each other , with Barghouti accusing Arafat ' s administration of corruption and his security services of human rights violations , and Arafat was planning to fire him shortly .	O O O O O O U-PER O U-PER O O O O O O B-PER L-PER O O U-PER O B-ORG|U-PER I-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O O O B-ORG|U-PER I-ORG L-ORG O U-PER O O O O U-PER O O O O U-PER O O

This was perhaps due to the transformation of Tanzim into an organization more resembling militant groups like Hamas and Islamic Jihad , responsible for dozens of civilian deaths in drive - by shootings . The FBI , concerned that terrorists could use lasers as weapons , is investigating why laser beams were directed into the cockpits of seven airplanes in flight since Christmas .	B-ORG L-ORG O O O U-PER O O U-WEA O U-WEA O O O O B-WEA L-WEA O O O B-VEH I-VEH I-VEH I-VEH|B-VEH I-VEH|I-VEH I-VEH|I-VEH L-VEH|L-VEH O O O
Laser beams can temporarily blind or disorient pilots and possibly cause a plane to crash .	B-WEA L-WEA O O O O O U-PER O O O B-VEH L-VEH O O O
The FBI is looking into two incidents in Colorado Springs , Colo . , and one each in Cleveland , Washington , Houston , Teterboro , N . J . , and Medford , Ore . , according to federal and local law enforcement and transportation officials , some of whom spoke only on condition of anonymity . A federal law enforcement official , who declined to be identified by name , said Thursday there is no evidence of a plot or terrorist activity .	B-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER|U-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER L-PER O O O O O O O O O O O U-PER O O

PoliticAlex also has some info on this story also .	U-PER O O O O O O O O O
I found the following report that was presented to Congress recently about the shoulder launched missle threat to airliners , which this might very well be a precursor to : Recent events have focused attention on the threat that terrorists with shoulder fired surface - to - air missiles ( SAMs ) , referred to as Man - Portable Air Defense Systems ( MANPADS ) , pose to commercial airliners .	U-PER O O O O O O O O U-ORG O O B-WEA I-WEA I-WEA L-WEA O O U-VEH O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER I-PER|B-WEA I-PER|I-WEA I-PER|I-WEA I-PER|I-WEA I-PER|I-WEA I-PER|I-WEA I-PER|I-WEA I-PER|L-WEA I-PER I-PER|U-WEA I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER|B-WEA I-PER|I-WEA I-PER|I-WEA I-PER|I-WEA I-PER|I-WEA I-PER|L-WEA I-PER L-PER|U-WEA O O O O B-VEH L-VEH O
Most believe that no single solution exists to effectively mitigate this threat .	U-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O
Instead , a menu of options may be considered , including installing infrared ( IR ) countermeasures on aircraft ; modifying flight operations and air traffic control procedures ; improving airport and regional security ; and strengthening missile non - proliferation efforts .	O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O U-VEH O O O O O O O O O O O U-FAC O O O O O O U-WEA O O O O O
Equipping aircraft with missile countermeasure systems can protect the aircraft even when operating in areas where ground - based security measures are unavailable or infeasible to implement .	O U-VEH O U-WEA O O O O B-VEH L-VEH O O O O B-LOC I-LOC|U-LOC I-LOC I-LOC I-LOC I-LOC I-LOC I-LOC I-LOC I-LOC I-LOC I-LOC L-LOC O
However , this option has a relatively high cost , between $ 1 million and $ 3 million per aircraft , and the time needed for implementation does not allow for immediate response to the existing terrorist threat .	O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O U-VEH O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O U-PER O O
Procedural improvements such as specific flight crew training , altering air traffic procedures to minimize exposure to the threat , and improved security near airports may be less costly than countermeasures and could more immediately help deter domestic terrorist attacks .	O O O O O B-PER L-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O U-FAC O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER|U-GPE L-PER O O
However , these techniques by themselves cannot completely mitigate the risk of domestic attacks and would not protect U . S . airliners flying to and from foreign airports .	O O O O O O O O O O O O U-GPE O O O O O B-VEH|B-GPE I-VEH|I-GPE I-VEH|L-GPE I-VEH I-VEH I-VEH I-VEH I-VEH I-VEH I-VEH|B-FAC L-VEH|L-FAC O
Legislation introduced in the 108th Congress ( H . R .	O O O B-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O O O O O
580 , S . 311 ) calls for the installation of missile defense systems in all turbojet aircraft used in scheduled air carrier service .	O O O O O O O O O O O U-WEA O O O B-VEH I-VEH I-VEH I-VEH I-VEH I-VEH I-VEH I-VEH L-VEH O
While this legislation is still under consideration , Homeland Security appropriations designated $ 60 million in FY2004 and $ 61 million in FY2005 to fund a program to develop and test prototype missile countermeasure systems for commercial aircraft based on existing military technology .	O O O O O O O O B-ORG L-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O U-WEA O O O B-VEH L-VEH O O O U-ORG O O
It is anticipated that at the conclusion of this program , in January 2006 , the Department of Homeland Security will be able to provide a detailed analysis of the suitability of such systems for use to protect commercial passenger aircraft .	O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-VEH I-VEH|U-PER L-VEH O

But responsibility for what ?	O O O O O
The truth is that , as director of U . N . peacekeeping , Annan personally refused requests to authorize U . N . peacekeepers in Rwanda to seize weapons and prevent genocide .	O O O O O O B-PER I-PER I-PER|B-ORG I-PER|I-ORG I-PER|L-ORG I-PER L-PER O U-PER O O O O O B-PER|B-ORG I-PER|I-ORG I-PER|L-ORG I-PER I-PER I-PER L-PER|U-GPE O O U-WEA O O O O
Writer and author Philip Gourevitch has described in detail how , three months before the genocide , Major General Romeo Dallaire , the commander of several thousand U . N . troops in Rwanda , sent a fax to Kofi Annan ' s office , saying he had received evidence from a Rwandan government informant that genocide was being planned .	B-PER|U-PER I-PER I-PER|U-PER I-PER L-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER|B-PER I-PER|L-PER I-PER L-PER O B-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER|B-PER I-PER|I-PER I-PER|I-PER|B-ORG I-PER|I-PER|I-ORG I-PER|I-PER|L-ORG I-PER|I-PER I-PER|I-PER I-PER|I-PER L-PER|L-PER|U-GPE O O O O O B-ORG|B-PER I-ORG|L-PER I-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O O U-PER O O O O B-PER|B-ORG I-PER|I-ORG|U-GPE I-PER|L-ORG L-PER O O O O O O
The informant offered to help U . N . forces in raiding the government stockpiles to be used in the genocide campaign .	B-PER L-PER O O O B-PER|B-ORG I-PER|I-ORG I-PER|L-ORG I-PER L-PER O O B-WEA I-WEA|U-ORG L-WEA O O O O O O O O
All that the informant wanted in return was protection for himself and his family .	O O B-PER L-PER O O O O O O U-PER O B-PER|U-PER L-PER O
But the general needed U . N . authorization to conduct such a raid and save lives .	O B-PER L-PER O B-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O O O O O O O O O U-PER O
He asked for that approval but the answer came back in a now - infamous " genocide fax " from Annan ' s office .	U-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG|U-PER I-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O
It denied authorization for the mission and told him that he should turn the information provided by the confidential witness over to the Rwandan government which was planning the genocide !	O O O O O O O O U-PER O U-PER O O O O O O B-PER I-PER L-PER O O B-GPE I-GPE|U-GPE L-GPE U-ORG O O O O O
The result was that the information dried up and the genocide took place .	O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

As rising instability in Lebanon increases tensions in the Middle East , the Bush administration is arguing with European governments over whether they should designate the Lebanon - based Shiite group Hezbollah a terrorist organization , American and European officials say .	O O O O U-GPE O O O B-GPE I-GPE L-GPE O B-ORG I-ORG|U-PER L-ORG O O O B-GPE|U-GPE L-GPE O O U-GPE O O B-ORG|B-ORG I-ORG|I-ORG|U-GPE I-ORG|I-ORG I-ORG|I-ORG I-ORG|I-ORG|U-PER I-ORG|L-ORG L-ORG B-ORG I-ORG|U-PER L-ORG O B-PER|U-GPE I-PER I-PER|U-GPE L-PER O O

In the past two weeks , the officials said , France has rebuffed appeals by Secretary of State Condoleezza Rice and the Israeli foreign minister , Silvan Shalom , to list Hezbollah as a terrorist organization , which would prevent it from raising money in Europe through charity groups .	O O O O O O B-PER L-PER O O U-GPE O O O O B-PER|B-PER I-PER|I-PER I-PER|L-PER|U-ORG I-PER L-PER O B-PER I-PER|U-GPE I-PER L-PER O B-PER L-PER O O O U-ORG O B-ORG I-ORG|U-PER L-ORG O O O O U-ORG O O O O U-GPE O B-ORG L-ORG O
The United States has long called Hezbollah a terrorist organization , but the French , American and European officials said , have opposed doing so , and argue that making such a designation now would be unwise , given the new turbulence in Lebanon .	B-GPE I-GPE L-GPE O O O U-ORG B-ORG I-ORG|U-PER L-ORG O O B-GPE L-GPE O B-PER|U-GPE I-PER I-PER|U-GPE L-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O U-GPE O

Mischie in jail	O O O
Nicolae Mischie , authoritarian leader of a district organization of the main opposition party , has been jailed .	B-PER L-PER O B-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER|B-ORG I-PER|I-ORG I-PER|I-ORG I-PER|I-ORG I-PER|I-ORG|B-ORG I-PER|I-ORG|I-ORG I-PER|I-ORG|I-ORG L-PER|L-ORG|L-ORG O O O O O
Romania voted in the last December , ousting the so - called socialist party PSD ( Social - Democratic Party ) .	U-GPE O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG L-ORG B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O O
PSD managed to keep a stronghold in poor rural areas , with the help of people like Mischie .	U-ORG O O O O O O B-LOC I-LOC L-LOC O O O O O B-PER I-PER L-PER|U-PER O
They combined blackmail , using their right of decision regarding the public funds for local leaders opposing PSD , and strong seduction of the uneducated masses , in a marvelous way .	U-ORG O O O O U-ORG O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER I-PER L-PER|U-ORG O O O O O B-PER I-PER L-PER O O O O O O
E . g . , Mischie , who talks like an idiot , got a PhD in history .	O O O O O U-PER O U-PER O O B-PER L-PER O O O O O O O
His paper was on a political personality of the 19th century and Mischie bought the house where his paper ' s subject lived .	U-PER O O O B-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER L-PER O U-PER O B-FAC I-FAC I-FAC|U-FAC I-FAC|B-PER|U-PER I-FAC|I-PER I-FAC|I-PER I-FAC|I-PER I-FAC|L-PER L-FAC O
Maybe he tried to invest in his paper , maybe he believed sincerely in his admiration for the poor innocent dead guy and his ability of earning PhDs , but using a big car and living in a big house are signs for the masses that the man is an invaluable and irreplaceable leader . The interim government declared a state of emergency in Iraq excluding the Kurdish region for 60 days , according to the National Security Law introduced last August which states that emergency laws can be declared in the country for a period no more than 60 days provided a serious threat against Iraqi national security is recognised by the interim government .	B-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O O O O O O U-GPE O B-LOC I-LOC|U-PER L-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-GPE L-GPE O O O O O O O O O O O O O U-GPE O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O
Obviously , this is a necessary step that should have been taken at least two months ago .	O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

- A clear timetable for the withdrawal of foreign occupation forces ( fair enough ) .	O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER L-PER O O O O O

- The removal of certain officials ( most of them from Shi ' ite Islamic parties such as Ibrahim Al - Ja ' fari ) from governmental positions . Sidenote : Mu ' awiya bin Abi Sufyan was the governor of Syria during the 7th century and he fought Imam Ali bin Abi Talib ( Muhammed ' s son - in - law ) over the Caliphate after the assassination of Caliph Othman . Daylight Savings Time is retarded	O O O O O
I am 36 years old .	U-PER O O O O O
I ' ve been around a while .	U-PER O O O O O O O
I ' m not 87 or anything , but I ' ve seen some things in my life .	U-PER O O O O O O O O U-PER O O O O O O U-PER O O
I have initially agreed and disagreed with different things over the years , only to have my mind changed later .	U-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O U-PER O O O O
However , I will never EVER change my mind about the idiocy we call Daylight Savings Time .	O O U-PER O O O O U-PER O O O O U-PER O O O O O
I Googled " Daylight Savings Time " and I got the following link :	U-PER O O O O O O O U-PER O O O O O
http : / / webexhibits . org / daylightsaving /	O O O O O O O O O O
I started reading . . .	U-PER O O O O O
The site says things like " We ' ve learned to save energy and enjoy sunny summer evenings by switching our clocks an hour forward in the summer " and there ' s no S at the end of Savings .	O O O O O O U-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O U-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
It should be Daylight Saving Time .	O O O O O O O
My apologies to the assclowns that invented this idiocy and the goobers that perpetuate it in such a ridiculous fashion .	U-PER O O B-PER I-PER I-PER|U-PER I-PER I-PER L-PER O B-PER I-PER I-PER|U-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER L-PER O
I will concede that " springing forward " and " falling back " are good ways to remember to change the batteries in your smoke detectors .	U-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O U-PER O O O
However , New Years and the Fourth of July would do the same thing .	O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
I kept reading the website of propoganda and found that the first person to come up with the idea was Benjamin Franklin who did it on behalf of some friends that owned oil companies ( oil was used in lamps ) .	U-PER O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER L-PER O B-PER I-PER I-PER|U-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER|B-PER I-PER|I-PER I-PER|I-PER|U-PER I-PER|I-PER I-PER|I-PER|B-ORG I-PER|I-PER|L-ORG I-PER|I-PER I-PER|I-PER I-PER|I-PER I-PER|I-PER I-PER|I-PER L-PER|L-PER O O
I assume that , because the idea was dumb and inconvenient , lots of people ignored it .	U-PER O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER L-PER O O O
" By 1966 , some 100 million Americans were observing DST based on their own local laws and customs .	O O O O B-PER I-PER I-PER L-PER O O O O O U-PER O O O O O O
Congress decided to step in to end the confusion and establish one pattern across the country .	U-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-GPE L-GPE O
The Uniform Time Act of 1966 ( 15 U . S . Code Section 260a ) which was signed into Public Law 89 - 387 on 12 April 1966 , by President Lyndon Johnson , created Daylight Saving Tim to begin on the last Sunday of April and to end on the last Sunday of October .	O O O O O O O O B-GPE I-GPE L-GPE O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER|U-PER I-PER L-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Any State that wanted to be exempt from DST could do so by passing a state law .	B-GPE I-GPE I-GPE|U-GPE I-GPE I-GPE I-GPE I-GPE I-GPE L-GPE O O O O O O U-GPE O O
There ' s a LOT more to this since then , and you can read a lot more it if you want to , but this is what I know :	O O O O O O O O O O O O U-PER O O O O O O O U-PER O O O O O O O U-PER O O
Indiana ' s eastern half doesn ' t use it .	B-LOC|U-GPE I-LOC I-LOC I-LOC L-LOC O O O O O O
What ' s THAT all about ?	O O O O O O O
Arizona doesn ' t use it because one tribe of Indians stretches into three states .	U-GPE O O O O O O B-PER I-PER I-PER L-PER|U-PER O O B-GPE L-GPE O
But those other states DO use it .	O B-GPE I-GPE L-GPE O O O O
Hawaii doesn ' t use it at all .	U-GPE O O O O O O O O
Of course , they ' re closer to Japan than to us , and since Japan doesn ' t use it , Hawaii just plays along .	O O O U-GPE O O O O U-GPE O O U-LOC O O O U-GPE O O O O O O U-GPE O O O O

Video Rentals : The Three Hypotheses	O O O O O O
Scrappy underdog Netflix had its day earlier in the year , when it became one of the hottest stocks around ( sporting an eye - popping P / E in the high 900 ' s on the way up , and , thanks to a poor earnings report , over 1 , 000 on the way down ) .	B-ORG|B-ORG I-ORG|L-ORG L-ORG O U-ORG O O O O O O O U-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
There ' s plenty of argument about the future of DVD and video rental , and Netflix represents a pure - play on one of the three dominant hypotheses :	O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O U-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O
That business is O - V - E - R - - Between pay - per - view , video - on - demand , pirated movies , high - bandwidth Internet broadcasts , and the increasing availability of other media , it takes some faith to see any future for movie rentals .	B-ORG L-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Those who don ' t have the requisite faith will point to these factors as proof that the business is dying and the movie business in general will need a pretty significant overhaul before it can make profits .	B-PER I-PER|U-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER L-PER O O O O O O O O B-ORG L-ORG O O O B-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O O O O O O O O O U-ORG O O O O
Movie rentals are no longer a cheap alternative to other ways of viewing films ; they ' re the stodgy , expensive way .	O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
There aren ' t any pure - play buys on this theory , but someone who believes it might overweight their portfolio in cable companies - - if they purchased any media stocks at all .	O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER|U-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER|U-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER|B-ORG L-PER|L-ORG O O O U-PER O O O O O O O
Of course , there have been companies whose performance would perfectly mimic the validity of this idea , but Psuedo . com failed without producing a single show , and Broadcast . com was swallowed for $ 6 billion by Yahoo ! , to Yahoo !	O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG|U-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O O B-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O O O O O O O U-ORG O O O U-ORG O
' s great regret .	O O O O O
Not so fast - - it ' ll just go online !	O O O O O O O O O O O O
- - Anyone who wants to counter that argument would probably start by taking us back to 1997 , when in terms of time used , text was the most popular kind of information online .	O O B-PER I-PER|U-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER L-PER O O O O O U-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
At the time , and for years after , people argued that the traditional bookstore would become obsolete .	O O O O O O O O O U-PER O O B-FAC I-FAC L-FAC O O O O
After all , how could we stand for a rapaciously arborcidal medium like ' books ' or ' newspapers ' when we could transmit the same data as bits and bytes and save on transportation , too ?	O O O O O U-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O U-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
As it turns out , of course , Amazon . com , BarnseandNoble . com , and a host of others simply took the bookstore model , attached a 56K modem , and declared themselves The Future .	O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O B-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O O O U-FAC O O O O O O O O O U-ORG O O O
Netflix is doing much the same thing : Taking the traditional business online to cut costs and boost customer service .	U-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O U-PER O O
Who d ' you think you ' re kidding ?	U-PER O O U-PER O U-PER O O O O
You can ' t kill movie rental stores - - So there ' s a big difference between movies and books : For books , the retail store is practically the sole medium of distribution ; if you don ' t sell through them , books won ' t get sold .	U-PER O O O O B-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-FAC I-FAC L-FAC O O B-FAC I-FAC I-FAC I-FAC L-FAC O O U-PER O O O O O U-FAC O O O O O O O O
For movies , the video rental store is just one way to get videos out there ( though at 45 - 55 % of studio revenues , it ' s a much more important one than people think ) .	O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O U-ORG O O U-ORG O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O O
But given the high valuations ascribed to bricks - and - mortar - and - dead tree booksellers like Barnes and Noble , Borders , and to a much lesser extent Books - A - Million , surely there ' s room for a Blockbuster , along with a Movie Gallery or two .	O O O O O O O B-FAC I-FAC I-FAC I-FAC I-FAC I-FAC I-FAC I-FAC I-FAC I-FAC I-FAC I-FAC I-FAC|B-ORG I-FAC|I-ORG I-FAC|L-ORG I-FAC I-FAC|U-ORG I-FAC I-FAC I-FAC I-FAC I-FAC I-FAC I-FAC I-FAC|B-ORG I-FAC|I-ORG I-FAC|I-ORG I-FAC|I-ORG L-FAC|L-ORG O O O O O O O B-ORG L-ORG O O O B-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O O O
The latter , at least , still has room to grow .	B-ORG L-ORG O O O O O O O O O O
By focusing on smaller , rural communities ( preferably the sort that considers DSL ' newfangled ' ) they ' re WalMarting WalMart - - competing with Walmart ' s awful in - store video rentals by offering better selection and much lower prices . WalMart : Conglomerating ?	O O O O
Conglomerates are a fascinating species : The standard definition is ' a company involved in multiple unrelated businesses ' but the more accurate definition would be ' a company that relies on financial pyrotechnics , balance sheet juggling , and adroit accounting to create the illusion of growth ' .	U-ORG O B-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG|U-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O O
I love to write about them , but I ' d hate to own one , since most of their market value comes from the market ' s assumption that the company ' s leaders will somehow find a way to retroactively justify their overvaluation .	U-PER O O O O U-ORG O O U-PER O O O O O U-ORG O O O O U-ORG O O O O O O O O O O B-PER|B-ORG I-PER|L-ORG I-PER I-PER L-PER O O O O O O O O U-PER O O
Usually , it doesn ' t work , but when it does the results can be spectacularly entertaining .	O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
For a while ( see Ling - Temco - Vought or Tyco for details ) .	O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O U-ORG O O O O
The recent rumors about WalMart ' s plans to buy out a shipping company have given rise to the fear that the company may go the conglomerate route .	O O O O U-ORG O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O O O O O O O B-ORG L-ORG O O O U-ORG O O
They have many of the symptoms of a late - stage conglomerate : A gigantic main business with slowing growth , fear that competition will substantially reduce the profitability of their main business , a shareholder base that includes many people who own only WalMart stock ( thus providing another incentive for intracompany diversification ) , and enough resources to pull it off on a grand scale .	U-ORG O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O U-ORG O O O B-PER I-PER|U-PER I-PER I-PER|U-PER I-PER I-PER|B-PER I-PER|I-PER I-PER|I-PER|U-PER I-PER|I-PER I-PER|I-PER I-PER|I-PER|U-ORG L-PER|L-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
I can understand the concerns , but I don ' t see the motivation .	U-PER O O O O O O U-PER O O O O O O O
As a retailer of just about everything , WalMart can expand into some pretty broadly - defined areas without going beyond either their core competencies or some arenas where they can cut costs .	O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O U-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O U-ORG O O O O O O U-ORG O O O O
After all , adding some international shipping assets to their holdings would be a natural extension of their enormously successful practice of buying the distribution network for their products .	O O O O O O O O O U-ORG O O O O O O O U-ORG O O O O O O O O O U-ORG O O
They ' re coming close to Smithfield Food ' s very successful ' squeal to meal ' policy ; if these rumors are true , the result for shareholders will be a pretty positive one .	U-ORG O O O O O B-ORG L-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O U-PER O O O O O O O

Back in the day ( 2000 - 2003 or so ) some of the hottest non - homebuilding stocks were the gaming equipment manufacturers , who rode a wave of heavy reinvestment in casinos to produce huge profits .	O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG|U-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG|U-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O

Russia ' s Situation Worsens	O O O O O
Gazprom , the main Russian gas company , has been denied a $ 10 billion credit line due to the political situation in Russia .	U-ORG O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG|U-GPE I-ORG L-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O U-GPE O

China : We could always ignore them , right ?	O O O O O O O O O O
One of the rules of thumb that has guided my ( limited ) business career from the beginning is that China is never as lucrative as it looks .	O O O O O O O O O U-PER O O O O O O O O O O U-GPE O O O O O U-GPE O O
This assumption is based on about 150 years of economic history , including several booms in interest and investment in China .	O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O U-GPE O
Their biggest problem : There ' s usually a 200 - to - 1 ratio of Nearly Starving Peasant Laborers to Absurdly Well - Off Government Employees .	U-GPE O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER I-PER L-PER O B-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER|U-GPE L-PER O
And now it ' s an iffier 100 - to - 1 , since there are also rich private sector employees and the labor force isn ' t quite so expendable .	O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER I-PER L-PER O B-PER I-PER L-PER O O O O O O O
What they ' ve been missing for years was the real driver behind any consumer economy : Consumers .	O U-GPE O O O O O O O O O O O O U-PER O O U-PER O
Specifically , they didn ' t have a real middle class .	O O U-GPE O O O O B-PER I-PER I-PER L-PER O
That ' s changed in the last twenty years , as increasing social mobility and a burst in foreign demand has finally made China a genuine , rather than theoretical , contender .	O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O U-GPE B-GPE I-GPE I-GPE I-GPE I-GPE I-GPE I-GPE L-GPE O
And they ' ve even supplied proof of their economic viability , announcing that they ' ve beaten Japan for exports to the US .	O U-GPE O O O O O O U-GPE O O O O O U-GPE O O O U-GPE O O O B-GPE L-GPE O
If only I ' d figured this out in early 2002 , when their stock market was by some stretch of the imagination cheap .	O O U-PER O O O O O O O O O O U-GPE O O O O O O O O O O O
I dunno if you want anything to do with their stock market .	U-PER O O U-PER O O O O O B-ORG|U-GPE I-ORG L-ORG O
For one , its perforance last year was pretty dismal .	O O O U-ORG O O O O O O O
More importantly , its a structural nuthouse .	O O O U-ORG B-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O
Unfortunately , minority shareholder rights are virtually non - existent , and excluding the dodgy financial statements listed on the exchange , lots of times companies are more interested in generating cash from an IPO then actually bothering with shareholder value . The Exponentials	O O
It ' s always difficult to get used to a central fact of the modern economy : The best new technology will keep getting better at an absolutely astounding rate .	O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Usually , the improvement curve flattens pretty fast - - the usual auto industry / computer industry comparison works just fine ( According to the standard urban legend , Bill Gates notes that " If we ' d been making cars instead of software , you ' d get 500 miles to the gallon , need an oil change every 250 , 000 miles , and be able to replace your car for $ 200 , " to which a mythical GM executive replies " Ah , but if Microsoft made cars , they ' d crash three times a day , too ! " ) .	O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG|U-VEH L-ORG O B-ORG L-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER L-PER O O O O U-ORG O O O O U-VEH O O O O U-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-VEH|U-PER L-VEH O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER I-PER|U-ORG L-PER O O O O O O U-ORG O U-VEH O U-VEH O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Anyway , a few announcements during the last two days underscore the fact that the growth in memory and processing power for computers is far from over : Hewlett - Packard is developing a new replacement for the transistor , and a consortium of software companies is backing a new technology that would allow discs to hold up to a terabyte of information .	O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG|B-ORG L-ORG|L-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
No idea where this will end up : It ' s not altogether rare that these announcements result in a very expensive project to develop something that , for whatever reason , isn ' t worthwhile to consumers .	O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O U-PER O
But it ' s important to remember that the status quo is never more than a snapshot - - investing as though it ' s permanent is a recipe for disaster .	O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The " Twin Deficits " Myth	O O O O O O
According to the usually reliable CNN / Money , the " Twin Deficits " will continue to grow .	O O O B-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Interesting terminology . . .	O O O O O
I believe they ' re referring to the budget deficit and . . . the capital surplus ?	U-PER O U-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
When analyzing trade deficits , it ' s important to realize that the amount by which imports exceed exports is also equal to the net amount foreign investors have bet on the US .	O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER L-PER O O O B-GPE L-GPE O
So the trade deficit is due to a confluence of the pressures from US consumers ( who control about 20 % of global GDP ) and everybody else ( excluding the non - consumption share of US GDP , that would amount to around 75 % of global GDP ) .	O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER|U-GPE I-PER I-PER I-PER|U-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER L-PER O O B-PER L-PER O O O O O O O O U-GPE O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Which of those is - - probably - - going to be a more important number ?	O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Even if we are consumers bent on gorging ourselves with imported goods , the largest pressure on the deficit is that we ' re simply a better place for investment - - higher returns on capital in developing countries are more than mitigated by the higher political risks they face .	O O U-GPE O B-GPE I-GPE I-GPE I-GPE I-GPE|U-GPE I-GPE I-GPE L-GPE O O O O O O O O O U-GPE O O O B-GPE I-GPE I-GPE I-GPE L-GPE O O O O O O O B-GPE L-GPE O O O O O O O O O U-GPE O O
And what about that other deficit ?	O O O O O O O
It , of course , is the ominous sum that we fund without taxes , but by borrowing funds .	O O O O O O O O O O U-GPE O O O O O O O O O
And about half of those borrowings end up with the major banks in Asia .	O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG L-ORG|U-GPE O
So , not to be a heretic , but 1 ) We ' re issuing them at relatively low interest rates , 2 ) Inflation is bound to pick up eventually , and so 3 ) Wouldn ' t you rather have our deficits made up by economically nonsensical purchases by non - US investors , rather than raising taxes in America ?	O O O O O O O O O O O U-GPE O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O U-PER O O U-GPE O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER I-PER|U-GPE L-PER O O O O O O U-GPE O
It ' s a question of who will pay for the same spending , and all else being equal I ' d be happy for Asian central banks to pick up the tab .	O O O O O O U-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O U-PER O O O O O B-ORG|U-GPE I-ORG L-ORG O O O O O O
The Twin Deficits are a reality , but they aren ' t exactly a terrifying one .	O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Gmail : Cachet for Everybody !	O O O O O O
At first , I was pretty skeptical of Gmail - - an announcement of something new , cool , and free , from a quirky company , on April Fool ' s Day ?	O O O U-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O O O O O O O O
Turns out my initial attitude wasn ' t justified , of course , and Gmail has been a popular success .	O O U-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Just this weekend , Google gave many users another fifty invitations , prompting some to speculate that it could be the start of Gmail ' s final move out of beta .	O O O O U-ORG O B-PER L-PER O O O O O U-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Their marketing was absolutely brilliant : Simply through association with Google , and because of the invitation - only membership , they created a product with instant cachet - - something so in demand invitations went for $ 50 on eBay , and one enterprising site even offered a kidney for an invite .	U-ORG O O O O O O O O O U-ORG O O O O O O O O O O U-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O U-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O
And now ?	O O O
Everyone who wants a Gmail account has one , and yet people with invites have an almost pathological desire to give them away .	B-PER I-PER|U-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER L-PER O O O O O B-PER I-PER L-PER O O O O O O O O O O
It ' s been nearly a year , the service is nearly ubiquitous , and somehow Google has kept us obsessed with Gmail .	O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O U-ORG O O U-PER O O O O

Even more blogospheric M & A ?	O O O O O O O
Frenetic merger and acquisition activity doesn ' t mean much in the early days of a business - - it ' s just as likely that ridiculously overfunded startups are buying out their bankrupt competitors to create larger and less stable conglomerates as it is that forward - thinking visionaries are cutting off their competitors early .	O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG L-ORG O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O O O B-ORG|U-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O O O O B-PER I-PER I-PER L-PER O O O B-ORG|U-PER L-ORG O O
But when an outsider buys into the business once it ' s established itself as important , but before it ' s really gotten profitable , it ' s big news .	O O B-ORG L-ORG O O B-ORG L-ORG O U-ORG O O O U-ORG O O O O O U-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O
For now , it ' s just a rumor that Ask Jeeves is buying Bloglines .	O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG L-ORG O O U-ORG O
I ' d keep an eye on this - - if Ask Jeeves pops on the news , the easy money from the blogging trend is already gone .	U-PER O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG L-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Poliblogs versus Stockblogs	O O O
Stephen of IRA - CAM is experiencing Sitemeter envy over all those succesful political blogs .	B-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER L-PER O O O O O O O O O O O
Understandable !	O O
After all , my biggest surge in hits came from a link from , well , a political blog .	O O O U-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
However , I ' d rather not worry - - instead , I ' d like to think of our situation as akin to Instapundit , or Andrew Sullivan , or Daily Kos in , say , the summer of 2001 .	O O U-PER O O O O O O O O O U-PER O O O O O O U-PER O O O O O O O B-PER L-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O

In politics , there ' s a definite four - year cycle , and any new medium can find its voice and carve out an audience in that time .	O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER L-PER O O O O

Your time will come .	U-PER O O O O

Those poliblog hits come at a cost .	O O O O O O O O

I can understand that .	U-PER O O O O
When you ' re blogging about stocks , it ' s possible - - though a little difficult - - to say " Okay , you ' re right , I ' m wrong .	O U-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O U-PER O O O O U-PER O O O O

And everyone can be reasonably happy .	O U-PER O O O O O

G ' s Investing - - Greenspan and Star Wars	O O O O O O O O O O
G ' s Investing argues that Alan Greenspan is a George Lucas - esque figure : In the Star Wars universe of George Lucas , he portrays a benevolent dictatorship ( or benevolent monarchy ) as being superior to a democracy , with the democracy being the system rife with bureaucracy and bloat .	B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O O B-PER L-PER O B-PER I-PER|B-PER I-PER|L-PER I-PER I-PER L-PER O O B-LOC I-LOC I-LOC I-LOC I-LOC I-LOC|B-PER L-LOC|L-PER O U-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

But one of the why dictatorships are so inferior to democracies is that democracy offers a stable , peaceful transfer of power .	O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Will we have that at the Fed , when Greenspan leaves	O U-PER O O O B-ORG L-ORG O O U-PER O

The one industry in which Europe incontrovertibly beats the US is their aviation industry , thanks mainly to the fact that their lawmakers have left the operation of the industry up to the people who own it , and left passenger ' s rights in the hands of choosy passengers . Khodorkovsky denies guilt	O O O
Well , I would , too .	O O U-PER O O O O
On the other hand , the Russian legal system is a bit less , well , legalistic - - they seem much more concerned about the chance that someone will harm the state than about actual matters of right and wrong . Southern states considering higher cigarette taxes ?	O O O O O O O
Good plan ; cigarettes impose pretty high penalties on states , inasmuch as the states are caretakers for plenty of people who are ill thanks to cigarettes .	O O O O O O O O O U-GPE O O O B-GPE L-GPE O B-GPE I-GPE I-GPE|B-PER I-GPE|I-PER I-GPE|I-PER|B-PER I-GPE|I-PER|I-PER|U-PER I-GPE|I-PER|I-PER I-GPE|I-PER|I-PER I-GPE|I-PER|I-PER I-GPE|I-PER|I-PER L-GPE|L-PER|L-PER O
What ' s notable in this debate , however , is that according to MSN Moneycentral , tobacco executives are attacking the tax by noting that " While North Carolina ' s excise tax is only 5 cents , the total taxes given to North Carolina by smokers adds up to more than 61 cents per pack . "	O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG L-ORG O B-PER L-PER O O O O O O O O O B-GPE L-GPE O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-GPE L-GPE O U-PER O O O O O O O O O O O
Okay , okay - - since the tobacco companies pay lots of money to the states , that ' s technically accurate .	O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O O O O O B-GPE L-GPE O O O O O O O
But the point of these taxes is to align the price of a pack with the cost to society , and inasmuch as these penalties aren ' t assessed on a per - pack basis , they don ' t - - they ' re a lump - sum reflection of the taxes these companies ought to have paid before .	O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O U-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG L-ORG O O O O O O
Interestingly , the policy of making cigarette buyers pay to compensate society for the costs they impose is a politically palatable synthesis of the unpalatable notion of simply refusing treatment unless they pay full cost .	O O O O O O B-PER L-PER O O O U-PER O O O U-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O U-PER O O O O
They ' re basically buying future medical care throughout their lives , rather than eventually making the ( healthy ) remainder of the populace pay up .	U-PER O O O O O O O O U-PER O O O O O O B-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER|B-GPE L-PER|L-GPE O O O
In short : Good plan .	O O O O O O
It ' s Good to be the King !	O O O O O O O O O
Here ' s an entertaining little morsel from Business Week Online ( no byline given ) :	O O O O O O O O B-ORG L-ORG O O O O O O O
But on the subject of succession , those two look like role models compared with insurance giant American International Group Inc . ( AIG ) , whose aging CEO has no plans to retire .	O O O O O O O B-PER L-PER O O B-PER L-PER O O B-ORG|B-ORG I-ORG|L-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG|U-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG|U-ORG I-ORG|B-PER I-ORG|L-PER I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O
Maurice R . " Hank " Greenberg , who turns 80 in May , groomed two sons to be successors , but both have since left AIG . Greenberg Sr . then created an office of the chairman in 2002 , which includes co - COOs Martin J . Sullivan and Donald P . Kanak .	B-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER|U-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER L-PER O O B-PER L-PER O O U-PER O O U-PER O O O U-ORG O B-PER L-PER O O O B-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER|B-PER I-PER|L-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER|U-PER I-PER I-PER|B-PER|B-PER|B-PER I-PER|I-PER|I-PER|I-PER I-PER|I-PER|I-PER|L-PER I-PER|I-PER|I-PER I-PER|I-PER|I-PER I-PER|I-PER|I-PER I-PER|I-PER|I-PER I-PER|I-PER|I-PER I-PER|I-PER|I-PER I-PER|I-PER|I-PER I-PER|I-PER|I-PER L-PER|L-PER|L-PER O
Both are considered possible successors , but the board won ' t know Greenberg ' s preference until his departure , when it opens a sealed letter .	U-PER O O B-PER L-PER O O B-PER L-PER O O O O U-PER O O O O U-PER O O O U-PER O O O O O
Perhaps this is a good time for a quick refresher . . . .	O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The CEO works for the board . . . end lesson .	B-PER L-PER O O B-PER L-PER O O O O O O
I guess it is not as straight forward when your CEO is also chairman and one of the largest shareholders .	U-PER O O O O O O O O B-PER|U-PER L-PER O O U-PER O B-PER I-PER I-PER|B-PER I-PER|I-PER L-PER|L-PER O
It would be tempting to get on my high horse right now about the need to separate the positions of CEO and Chairman but to be honest with you I don ' t really believe that .	O O O O O O O U-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O U-PER O U-PER O O O O O U-PER U-PER O O O O O O O
I know CEO / chair duality is a popular cause for corporate governance .	U-PER O U-PER O U-PER O O O O O O O O O
However there is little empirical evidence to suggest that separating these roles affects firm performance in either a positive or negative way .	O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Having a combined CEO / Chairman does reduce the ability of the board to act as a check on management and this does mean that you need to be more critical in your assessment of the trustworthiness of the top management team .	O B-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER L-PER O O O O O B-PER L-PER O O O O O O U-PER O O O O O U-PER O O O O O O U-PER O O O O O B-PER I-PER I-PER L-PER O
This downside of having a combined CEO / chair is offset by ( 1 ) a reduction of coordination and communication costs at the top of the organization and ( 2 ) an increase in the negotiating position of the CEO when dealing with suppliers , potential merger partners , etc .	O O O O B-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER L-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER L-PER O O O U-ORG O B-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O O O
# 2 could be particularly useful in a dynamic industry .	O O O O O O O O O O O
I do however look more carefully at the top management team of a company with a CEO / Chair before investing .	U-PER O O O O O O B-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER|B-ORG I-PER|I-ORG I-PER|I-ORG I-PER|I-ORG|B-PER I-PER|I-ORG|I-PER I-PER|I-ORG|I-PER L-PER|L-ORG|L-PER O O O
It is important that you can get a sense of the trustworthiness of the CEO .	O O O O U-PER O O O O O O O O B-PER L-PER O
Is there high turnover among senior managers ?	O O O O O B-PER L-PER O
Is there a record of regulatory problems ?	O O O O O O O O
If the CEO is new , I also look at the performance of the CEO ' s previous company .	O B-PER L-PER O O O U-PER O O O O O O B-ORG|B-PER I-ORG|L-PER I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O
I am most concerned if the fortunes of the prior employer took a sudden turn for the worse after the CEO left .	U-PER O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O O O O O O O O B-PER L-PER O O
How to find securities class action lawsuits	O O O O O O O
Yesterday ' s bad day for Krispy Kreme included some speculation that the new securities lawsuit filed against the company would be granted class action status .	O O O O O O B-ORG L-ORG O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG L-ORG O O O O O O O
If you are interested in getting information about securities class actions for a company , you should check out the Stanford Law School ' s Securities Class Action Clearinghouse .	O U-PER O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG L-ORG O U-PER O O O B-ORG|B-ORG I-ORG|I-ORG I-ORG|I-ORG I-ORG|L-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O
This site has a very easy to use search function and it might be worth the time to run a quick check on companies of interest to you as possible investments .	O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG|U-PER I-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O
Researchers affiliated with the clearinghouse just released an interesting report about securities class action trends during 2004 .	B-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER|B-ORG L-PER|L-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The results highlight trends in types of filings ( increase in product market related filings ) , affected sectors ( big increase in energy & technology sector ) , and overall number of filings ( fairly steady ) .	O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG L-ORG O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O
Get the full report here or the press release here .	O O O O O O O U-ORG O O O
Shareholders Benefit from Employer Reputation	O O O O O
It is just about time for Fortune magazine to release its 2005 list of 100 Best Companies to Work For .	O O O O O O B-ORG L-ORG O O U-ORG O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O
So now is a good time to ask a simple question : Why should we care ?	O O O O O O O O O O O O O O U-PER O O

Well , thanks for asking because I just happen to have an answer for that question .	O O O O O O U-PER O O O O O O O O O O
It turns out that investors can benefit by paying attention to this list as well .	O O O O U-PER O O O O O O O O O O O
In a study published in the Journal of Business Finance & Accounting ( 2003 , 30 : 771 - 798 ) , Greg Filbeck and Dianna Preece found that companies on the Fortune list of 100 Best Companies to Work For outperformed a matched sample of firms along multiple measures of return .	O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O O O O O O O O O O B-PER L-PER O B-PER L-PER O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG|U-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG|B-ORG I-ORG|I-ORG I-ORG|I-ORG I-ORG|I-ORG I-ORG|I-ORG L-ORG|L-ORG O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG L-ORG|U-ORG O O O O O O
This study is particularly relevant for investors because the authors measured return after the list was announced .	O O O O O O U-PER O B-PER L-PER O O O O O O O O
To often these studies use as a starting point the moment before information becomes public .	O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The only way to benefit from such information is by holding the stock before the information becomes public .	O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This study indicates that the Best Companies to Work For information may still be useful even after the information becomes public .	O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O
It might also be useful to look at companies that have consistently made the list in the previous few years and make an educated guess about their inclusion on this year ' s list .	O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG|U-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O O O O O O U-ORG O O O O O O O O
Search the news archives and see if in the past year the company did anything that might have totally pissed off their employees .	O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG L-ORG O O O O O O O O B-PER|U-ORG L-PER O
Massive layoffs , bitter union battles , stopped offering free massages , etc .	O O O O U-ORG O O O O O O O O O
You might also want to be wary if the CEO or a bunch of other top executives have been replaced .	U-PER O O O O O O O B-PER L-PER O B-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER|B-PER I-PER|I-PER L-PER|L-PER O O O O
That can often generate a period of uncertainty in a workforce .	O O O O O O O O O B-PER L-PER O
Better Late Than Ne . . . Aww forget it !	O O O O O O O O O O O

None of this is really new information .	O O O O O O O O
So the worst is behind them right ?	O O O O O U-ORG O O
Maybe .	O O
Late filing of audited financial statements and earning restatements both factor into my External Reporting organizational indicator .	O O O O O O O O O O O O U-PER O O O O O
As a rule , I am wary of companies that do either of these things until I am confident that they have changed their standard business practices .	O O O O U-PER O O O B-ORG I-ORG|U-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O U-PER O O O U-ORG O O U-ORG O O O O
It may take a couple years , and several more financial filings ( on time of course ) , before I am persuaded to take a second look at the company .	O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O U-PER O O O O O O O O B-ORG L-ORG O
The bottom line is that I rely on SEC filings to assess companies and I don ' t want to have any doubt about the veracity of the information contained in these documents .	O O O O O U-PER O O U-ORG O O O U-ORG O U-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In Nortel ' s defense , they have just gone through the perfect storm in the telecommunications equipment sector .	O U-ORG O O O O U-ORG O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O
The whole industry overbuilt and got blindsided by the tech downturn .	B-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O O O O O O O O O
This could be described as a growth industry that went on a bender and is now trying to recover from the hangover .	O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O
I ' ve always felt that you learn a lot about someone when you see how they try to recover from a hangover ( pause for brief college flashback ) .	U-PER O O O O O U-PER O O O O U-PER O U-PER O O U-PER O O O O O O O O O O U-ORG O O O
This is a great time to assess organizational effectiveness in the telecommunications equipment industry .	O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O
Nortel and Lucent attempted to hide the damage ( What do you mean ?	U-ORG O U-ORG O O O O O O O O U-PER O O
I ' m not drunk ! )	U-PER O O O O O O
and hope for an uptick in demand before they would have to come clean .	O O O O O O O O U-ORG O O O O O O
Both companies have been penalized for these actions and have continued to restructure operations , sell assets , and layoff employees .	B-ORG L-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O U-PER O
Cisco , on the other hand , was able to take one huge restructuring charge in 2001 and move forward .	U-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Their ability to do this and have it work ( so far ) indicates a very deep and impressive understanding of their organization .	U-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O U-ORG O O
Especially when compared to its competitors , Cisco seems to be back in fighting form due to it ' s ability to rapidly assess its organizational structure and reconfigure to meet the changing market . Beyond Hippies and Tree Huggers	O O O O O
Socially responsible investing .	O O O O
Corporate social responsibility .	O O O O
Just saying these words seems to elicit some fairly simplistic knee - jerk reactions .	O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The reaction that I find most amusing is the knowing look of sympathy .	O O O U-PER O O O O O O O O O O
You know , the one that says " Poor naive soul .	U-PER O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER L-PER O
If only you understood economics , you would understand the folly of your ways . "	O O U-PER O O O U-PER O O O O O U-PER O O O
I do not intend to get into the stakeholder vs stockholder debate here or argue the relative merits of Atlas Shrugged .	U-PER O O O O O O O U-PER O U-PER O O O O O O O O O O O
Those discussions , though interesting , avoid a simpler question .	O O O O O O O O O O O
Do measures of corporate social responsibility contain valuable added information that help investors pick winning investments ?	O O O O O O O O O O O O U-PER O O O O
If all that you have read about this topic is an article in Business Week or The Wall Street Journal , you ' ve probably heard the standard answer - - the evidence is mixed .	O O O U-PER O O O O O O O O O B-ORG L-ORG O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG L-ORG O U-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
That is true but not very revealing wouldn ' t you say ?	O O O O O O O O O O U-PER O O
Evidence is mixed mostly because ( 1 ) there is little agreement about how to measure social responsibility and ( 2 ) many current measures toss together a heap of information that has no business being lumped together .	O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG L-ORG O O O O
Social responsibility often includes everything from treatment of employees to type of product produced .	O O O O O O O O U-PER O O O O O O
There is not really any reason to believe that selling guns or tobacco has anything to do with forcing employees to work unpaid overtime .	O O O O O O O O O O U-WEA O O O O O O O O U-PER O O O O O
Yet both get lumped together in the socially responsible investing discussion .	O O O O O O O O O O O O
Once you start to break apart social responsibility into its various components , you start to see the valuable information .	O U-PER O O O O O O O O O O O U-PER O O O O O O O
Companies that have poor employee relations tend to underperform , as do companies that pollute at a higher rate than their industry peers .	B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG|U-PER L-ORG O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG|U-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG|B-ORG|U-ORG I-ORG|I-ORG L-ORG|L-ORG O
On the other hand , companies with numerous NLRB violations don ' t do worse than their peers and companies that sell your typical " sin " products ( tobacco , firearms , gambling ) can be excellent investments .	O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG|U-ORG L-ORG O O O O O O B-ORG|U-ORG L-ORG O B-ORG I-ORG|U-ORG I-ORG I-ORG|U-PER I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG|U-WEA I-ORG L-ORG O O O B-ORG L-ORG O
Lump all these things together and of course you will get mixed results .	O O O O O O O O U-PER O O O O O
Taken separately , they provide valuable information about future firm performance .	O O O O O O O O O U-ORG O O
I guess it is time to get beyond the image of the greedy capitalist vs . hippie tree hugger in this discussion .	U-PER O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER L-PER O O B-PER|U-PER I-PER L-PER O O O O
Though that would make a great Celebrity Death Match episode .	O O O O O O O O O O O
Here are abstracts from 16 significant studies about socially responsible investing and an interesting essay on the subject .	O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
